meanings.definition: A style of abstract painting characterized by spontaneous brushwork and non-representational forms.
meanings.sent1: The artist's tachisme was evident in the bold strokes and vibrant colors of the painting.
meanings.sent2: Many art enthusiasts appreciate the freedom of expression found in tachisme.
meanings.sent3: The tachisme in the artwork seemed to dance across the canvas playfully.
meanings.sent4: Her tachisme was like a wild storm of creativity unleashed on the blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The gallery was filled with the energy of tachisme, each painting telling a unique story.

meanings.definition: The practice or principles of tachisme as an art movement.
meanings.sent1: Studying the history of tachisme helps understand its impact on modern art.
meanings.sent2: Art students often explore the techniques used in tachisme to broaden their skills.
meanings.sent3: The class discussed the philosophy behind tachisme with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, tachisme stands out as a revolutionary movement.
meanings.sent5: The museum dedicated an entire exhibit to the evolution of tachisme in the art world.
